benchmark_details.name: ELITR-Bench (Evaluation of Long-context LLMs in Meeting Assistant Scenarios)
benchmark_details.overview: ELITR-Bench is a benchmark designed to evaluate long-context language models in real-world meeting assistant scenarios, incorporating transcripts obtained by automatic speech recognition and assessing the models' robustness to various noise levels.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To create a benchmark that evaluates the performance of long-context LLMs in scenarios relevant to meeting assistants, challenging LLMs with real-world noise and context-based questioning.

data.source: Meeting transcripts from the ELITR project supplemented with manually crafted questions and ground-truth answers.
data.size: 10 meetings in dev set, 8 meetings in test set
data.annotation: Questions and answers are manually created and validated.

methodology.calculation: Scores are calculated based on the closeness of model predictions to the ground-truth answers.
methodology.interpretation: Scores reflect the model's ability to accurately respond to questions based on the provided meeting transcripts.
methodology.baseline_results: GPT-4 and GPT-4o achieved average scores above 8 on ELITR-Bench.
methodology.validation: Validation of the evaluation method was performed through comparison with human judges.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data collection complied with ethical regulations and guidelines including anonymization of personally identifiable information.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: The data is made publicly available under appropriate licenses.
